newsitem.title: FRANCE: Rhone says no fire at U.S. Hammond plant.
newsitem.headline: Rhone says no fire at U.S. Hammond plant.

text.p: French chemicals group Rhone-Poulenc denied an agency report of a fire at its Hammond plant in Chicago on Friday and said a problem at the plant was caused by fumes leaking from a vat of organic solvents.

It said in a statement that security measures, including a request to local authorities to seal off part of the surrounding area to traffic, were immediately put in place and the situation was brought under control within two hours.
Rhone said there was no interruption of the sulphur activities at the plant, notably the production of sulphuric acid.
